Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BurbageFolk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with friends. Hotel was somewhat different from the norm, with most areas and rooms decorated in an old-fashioned style. Staff very helpful and friendly. Having seen the comments about noise, I emailed in advance to request quiet rooms, which were duly provided - but don't expect a view! Rooms were average in size for a two-star hotel in a large city, and the bathroom was well-equipped, although you needed a safe-breaker's touch on the shower controls. Breakfast is 100% help yourself, but the choice was very wide, with the usual cold meats, cereals, yoghurts, fruit juices, breads, boiled eggs etc, including a changing array of croissants & danish pastries. The dining room was quite attractive, looking out onto an enclosed terrace at the rear of the hotel The location is good, located at the north end of La Raval, within three or four minutes walk to La Rambla or Placa Catalunya, where you will find the Tourist Information Office and stops for all the tourist and airport buses

Reviews.Title: “Good but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Nblakey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in central position staff are great .rooms are nice small but very nosy but if u are out most night u don't really notice . Rooms cleaned and towels changed every day even on bank holidays

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, old world decor, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tvplano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meson Castilla in late March 2012 for 5 nights. I selected the hotel for its location as well as the traditional decor. We were not disappointed. I booked our rooms via email directly with the hotel, and asked for upper floor rooms away from the street. Our double superior room had a balcony with a view of the mountain (Tibidabo) and rooftops. Our room was on the back of the hotel on the 5th floor. (there is an elevator). My friend's room (single standard) was on the same floor but faced the front of the hotel. She could hear sounds from the neighboring rooms but not loud enough to disturb her sleep. We heard no street sounds at all in our room. We did hear faint sounds of the TV from the neighboring room a couple of times. The beds were comfortable, water in bathrooms had good pressure, shower was always hot. Linens were clean and good quality, soap and shampoo sachets were provided. So was a hairdryer. There was a TV and a phone in the room. We could get CNN and BBC. Free internet in the room, good speeds. Breakfast buffet was generous and good quality. Boiled eggs, toast, rolls, danish, croissants, yogurt, muesli/cereals, cheese, salami, ham, fresh tomatoes, fresh whole fruit, juices, coffee, tea, hot and cold milk. There was a toaster to make fresh toast. Coffee was excellent. There was a patio for outdoor seating. The hotel was 5 minutes walk from Catalunya metro station and 2 minutes from Universitat metro station. There were several restaurants close by. The front desk staff were very helpful, knowledgeable and spoke English. They take major credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “city break”
Reviews.Author: marke11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in March 12 on a city break. hotel is in a great situation. Our room was at the front of the hotel. Yes some street noise but mostly first thing in the morning from street cleaners and bottle bank directly opposite the hotel, but remember this is a citycentre hotel. We both slept well- comfortable bed.. Room basic but comfortable, with small bathroom. Breakfast was a good continental breakfast. Staff all very helpful. We thoughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend..

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Meson Castilla in March 2011 for what was an altogether fantastic fiftieth birthday celebration for yours truly. I am an avid football fan and ex-player, so to take in the La Liga game at the Camp Nou on the Saturday (19th March my actual birthday) was a dream come true, I was also lucky enough to take the museum tour on the Monday prior ro our departure back to the UK. Our hotel was perfectly situated, just of the main drag leading to Las Ramblas it was quiet enough to get some much needed sleep, yet close enough to the buzz of Barcelona itself. The bedrooms were comfortable, the food was good and the staff were very helpful, as it says in the brochure, the Hotel was very traditional which all added to the experience. A superb time was had by all, my son, brother-in-law and myself took in the football while the women went shopping

Reviews.Title: “Try it”
Reviews.Author: Anjastop
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice staff, good breakfast, very clean and ok price. Smaller downsides were small room, window facing the wall (still not very close to the wall) and not so comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: docus48
Reviews.Content: Very well placed - just a few minutes walk from the airport bus and the tourist bus (strongly recommended). Our room was fairly basic but spotlessly clean. Beds very comfortable. Our room looked out over the back of buildings, so no view but was amazingly quiet for a city hotel - a real bonus. There are sitting areas but no bar and only a machine for coffee. Breakfast was adequate. Staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. If you like to lounge around a hotel or your room for much of the day this is not the place for you. But if you want a good basic base to explore a fascinating city, this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great for groups.”
Reviews.Author: Yorktn
Reviews.Content: 41 of us stayed here in February. There just was too much inconsistency in the rooms for such a large group. One room had a bathroom down the hall - not good. However, if you're travelling as a couple there are some nice, if small, rooms to be had in this hotel. From that pt of view this is a very good 2 star hotel (almost 3 star quality). There is a terrific breakfast room that feels like you're in back in the 30s. Basic but good breakfast. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It may be worth slumming it for this alone.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located and very friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: This is the second visit we have made to Meson Castilla. Previously we had a family room with our children (10 years ago). This time we were with friends and it was pleasing to see that the very friendly owner is still there as are some of the senior staff. It gives the feel of a small family hotel and avoids the style of impersonal big hotels. The Hotel really scores because of its location, which is just 5 minutes from the top the Ramblas and within easy reach of the central attractions such as the Gaudi buildings. As other reviewers have mentioned, it serves a good buffet breakfast in a pleasant Catalan dining room with a small terrace if there in the summer. The only downside I picked up this time around was the street noise affecting rooms on the front, and this can go on till early hours. However when you combine price, location and the friendly staff then I have little hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned hotel - in a nice way !”
Reviews.Author: Barrie G
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay in Barcelona one night to wait for my connecting flight. I asked at tourist information at aiport for hotel and (finding that there is a regular bus to airport) asked for a hotel in the city. They offered this one at a good price (well under list price). I am very pleased I took it. It has lots of old fashioned charm and it seems to be in a busy part of the city. The room was warm, the bed was soft, the shower worked, I couldn't hear anyone rearranging their wardrobe. Perfect. If you are obsessed about breakfasts then this wouldn't hit the mark for you because it was basic.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, no frills hotel in great location close to Catalunya / Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: PeatFeet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend (three nights) at the end of February 2012. The hotel was easy to find and dead close to the Catalunya Metro Station. On check in we were given a friendly welcome and a photocopied set of instructions for avoiding pickpockets and thieves as well as some useful general advice from the receptionist. Service was friendly but our room was disappointing - small and very hot. The room looked onto an internal light well and was mostly dark. The bathroom had no window or ventilation and a single flourescent light. The minibar was surpisingly reasonably priced (2 Euro for a can of San Miguel, 1.5 Euro for a bottle of water) and there was a vending machine on the ground floor. The depressing room was ok for a three night trip but we'd have struggled if we were there for longer, it certainly wasn't the sort of place where you'd want to chill out. Also the acoustics of the lightwell meant that if someone was talking loudly at the bottom, it sounded like they were sat next door to you. Breakfast was ok - there was a lot of it and service was friendly but coffee was from a machine and the milk was UHT. We ended up nipping to the starbucks nearby to get coffee with fresh milk. What was amazing about this hotel was where it was only a few minutes walk from the Ramblas and Catalunya. We also walked up Passeig de Gracia to Casa Batllo one morning and it only tool about 15 minutes. We were also happy walking back at night. We'd read a lot about pickpockets and muggings but we didn't once feel uncomfortable, although it wasn't at the height of the season. There was no safe in our room so for 5 Euros we rented a safebox from the hotel and left our passports in that. We enjoyed our trip but we would think twice about staying here again, mainly because of the heat of the room and the lack of facilities e.g. coffee/tea maker, safe in room, ventilation in bathroom etc. But the service was lovely, helpful and useful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Janesi19
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here last weekend and cannot fault the hotel in any way. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially at reception and in the breakfast room. Although our room was very small and had no view other than out into an internal light well - it was more than adequate for our trip - we only used it to sleep in. The breakfast was ample and very nicely presented. The hotel we thought was ideally placed for sightseeing - 5 mins from Las Rambla and Plaza Catalunya, what more could you want. Excellent. Would definitely use again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well done hotel in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: andreaski18
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 friends spent New Years Eve in this small hotel this year. we had been a bit put off by the emphasis on noise and thin walls but were agreeably surprised to find ourselves in a reasonably sized room with a large bathroom,where the window looked out on nothing much but a quiet nothing much! Seems a good idea to ask for a non street facing room as there was some noise from neighbours but not anything extreme. Very well situated,decorated in a very Spanish colour scheme ,friendly staff and not too expensive. No garage except nearby public one at about 30 eoros for the day but even on this busy day there was room. Buffet breakfast convenient and OK though 3 rather than five star I would say.Altogether well worth a look for central Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the centre of this fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: The_Canny_Scot
Reviews.Content: If you want five star luxury and all the fancy bits then this hotel is not for you. However if traditional spanish is what you want then this is the place to stay in Barcelona. Very authentic, friendly staff and a buffet breakfast that would do justice to any five star. The city never sleeps so why go for the more expensive hotels when you are never there. Go for it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bring the earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: krabikrazy
Reviews.Content: Good location etc but oh the walls are thin, the neighbours got their clothes out of the cupboard at 6 in the morning and you would swear`they were in the wardrobe in my room! Could hear a man snoring all night and had to whisper if u got home late. Not a place for enjoying the Barcelona nights and sleeping in, only for the early risers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyMLondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (if you can call someone aged 60 a boy!) and I decided to go to Barcelona for our first holiday together. We were delighted with this hotel both in terms of comfort and location. Situated only a few minutes' walk from The Ramblas and with excellent transportation nearby we thorougly enjoyed exploring this vibrant city. Our hotel room more than fulfilled our expectations, being both spacious and very clean. The hotel was decorated in a traditional Spanish way which had great character. The continental breakfast was delicious: fresh rolls, pastries, salami and cheese. All delicious and plentiful. We can highly recommend this hotel and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value; good location”
Reviews.Author: SandyD27
Reviews.Content: Some charm, rooms are small, but adequte, clean , +hotel has helpful, friendly service. Quiet although close to Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya. Most of all, a great value at 125 Euros per night including extended continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RosiePearce
Reviews.Content: My Husband and two children ages 8 and 5 stayed for 4 nights and we were made very welcome and comfortable. We arrived in the pouring rain and we paid a small token of 2 euros for our clothes to be dried. The hotel is very well situated in the lively and authentic University area, we felt very safe. The breakfasts were lovely, and our children loved the great variety inc Spanish treats of cake melon, cheese and ham, and also cocoa pops, and yogurt, The decor was interesting , but what I particually valued was the extreemly helpful and staff. I would definatly recommend..and would love to go back ..next time without the children...!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Rate - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: karlowsj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as it was listed as an historical hotel. The very friendly greeting, luggage room and safe for storing passports as we arrived at 8AM were appreciated. The hotel is fascinating to look at all the photos and Spanish design in furniture. The breakfast included was a pleasant start to our sightseeing days. Great location just minutes from Las Ramblas (where you want to stroll with the locals, look at the food market and of course eat the fabulous food Barcelona is noted for). Good bus from airport - also took the metro which was very easy or walked the boulevard many times. Only problem was directions from the airport bus to the hotel were not clear and we had to ask 5 people for directions. Good value as Barcelona is pricey with the Euro for North Americans. Clean, friendly and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to saty”
Reviews.Author: Datchet
Reviews.Content: a refreshing change to stay in a hotel with character but within an easy walk of la ramblas. staff are helpful and friendly, breakfast is excellent. our rooms were at the front of the hotel, noisy as there is no double glazing, so would suggest taking ear plus if your are a light sleeper. would definitely stay there again, a great long weekend to celebrate my birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: daveprecht
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Barcelona may times,but this hotel is the ideal choice for staying close to the bustling La Ramblas. It is a typical traditional Spanish hotel,Staff are very friendly and speak good english for those who are not conversant in spanish. The breakfast is excellent,and can be eaten outside in a lovely terrace area. Prices are reasonable,considering the central location of the hotel. p.s Ask for a room with a roof terrace,gret view.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: AshlingMG
Reviews.Content: Hotel is grand, room was small but quiet. Room and bathroom were very clean, location was central.

Reviews.Title: “A nice convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydneygirl182
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August. The hotel is centrally located near Las Ramblas, and is surrounded by some funky shops in the area. Our room wasn't huge but everything was nice and clean with a balcony and a small fridge in the room. Breakfast was good, a nice fresh selection every morning and the staff were very helpful, albeit it probably does help to speak a little spanish.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and would go back.”
Reviews.Author: wakeylass_11
Reviews.Content: A lovely 2 star hotel,not far from local attractions,metro and other amenities. Rooms were clean and cleaned on a daily basis,staff friendly and helpful any time day or night. Breakfast a typical continental style, enjoyed sitting on the sun terrace eating same. Had my doubts at first about the area as it looks intimidating on first impressions but felt quite safe on a night. although on a night in las Ramblas be aware of pick pockets. A must is the sight seeing bus that takes you to all the main points of interests. Also no visit to Barcelona wouldn't be the same without a visit to the Nou Camp experience.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeahSpencer
Reviews.Content: Even if the rooms were not large and spotless, if the included breakfast were not bountiful and delicious, if the staff were not kind and entirely professional, the very reasonable room rates at Meson de Castilla would make it impossible to find fault with this charming retreat reminiscent of Deep Spain. While my husband was particularly impressed with the tortilla de patatas and excellent coffee, I enjoyed the leafy, tiled terrace and admired the efficiency and generosity of the kitchen staff. Instead of whisking dishes away at the stroke of ten, when breakfast was supposed to end, smartly uniformed ladies invariably brought out fresh trays of fruit, chorizo, and pastries, greeting latecomers warmly. We have found our new favorite hotel in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Quite noisy, but very charming and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: krisbeee
Reviews.Content: My cousin chose this cute hotel between the University and Catalunya Metro stops, just a short walk from La Rambla. I shared a large room with three family members for six nights (uh, not recommended), but most of the single rooms were pretty tiny. Our room was on the first floor overlooking the street, and it was noisy -- especially when the "club de rock" across the street closed around 4 a.m. Despite that, and its two-star rating, we all really liked this hotel. Pros: Air conditioning, nice clean bathroom, free buffet breakfast with outdoor terrace, free Wi-Fi, relatively inexpensive, convenient location (explore the side streets around the hotel -- great shops and cafes). Safe-deposit boxes available. Cons: Loud day and night; bring earplugs. Mostly sullen staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Quiet Gem, Great Position”
Reviews.Author: holgalleeds
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel, loved its Olde worldy spanish feel. ROOMS - very clean, Air conditioned, TV, double wardrobe + 3 main drawer space + small drawers in bedside cabinets. FRIDGE - mini bar/ drinks- expensive compared to local shops. BATHROOM - has bath & shower + bidet & good hairdryer, towels changed daily, basic soap & shampoo provided. No hospitality tray, but plug availability for own kettle etc. Lift to all floors. Each floor has a sofa/chair sitting area with papers provided, very cosy. DINING - Very nice dining area entrance + outside patio where we ate B/fast. This Hotel only does CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST- cereals,yoghurt,cheese,ham,tomatoes spanish omellette croissants, cakes,, fruit juice, apples, melon, coffee + DIY toast, honey, packet biscuits. PATIO- at end of dining room - Availability from B/fast till 9 pm.- During day do not be put off by sign on door which covers the small bolt, just undo & enter. 9 pm closure for guests- Prob to avoid noise for early risers !!! No dinner/lunch or bar availability at this Hotel, prob due to the multi restaurant/bar availability in surrounding area. SMOKERS - Some rooms have balconys which smoking presumably is allowed as ash trays are provided in drawers of bedside cabinets. RECEPTION STAFF - So helpfull, & pleasant, we had booked Tablaeo de carmen & had to phone the venue 24 hrs pre visit + taxi. RECEPTION STAFF arranged it all for us. No hassle !! GENERAL REVIEW OF HOTEL Accommodation great,; Staff reserved but VERY helpful - Location Fantastic, Food - adequate, WILL DEF bookj this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, okay for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mrbubble70
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 4 days after a cruise. Breakfast was free, which was a bonus. The ac worked well for us but not in our companion's room. It was very clean and the price was good. I would stay here again if it was a short stay due to the cleanliness of the room and inexpensive price.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Pippick
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for one week in May. Long before we had returned home we had decided to return. Meson was clean and the room and breakfast were super. How this hotel only falls into the 2 star category is totally beyond me. A fantastic stay and we simply cannot wait to return. Ian

Reviews.Title: “Very surprising treat”
Reviews.Author: Edie022
Reviews.Content: I want to let future guests know what an absolute gem this hotel is! I had read other negative reviews so I was nervous. But as soon as I was greated in reception by a super-friendly lady, my worries disappeared. The staff were so helpful & I felt completely relaxed while there. They were really patient with me as my Spanish isn't brilliant & they had plenty advice on being safe in the city! I had expected a slightly rubbish room to be honest as I was travelling alone & have stayed in pretty basic rooms. My room had been described as single with bath- imagine my joy when I unlocked the door to find a gorgeous double bed with the infamous decor in a very spacious room. The bathroom was bigger than expected & I have to say, immaculate, including the shower curtain! Oh, I should also mention my room was towards the rear of the hotel & I didn't hear any noise from the street or other guests. I am, without a doubt, going to stay there again & would not hesitate in reccommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “take note of the not so positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: smsacacac
Reviews.Content: very noisy hotel,didnt bother the children.breakfast! not paletable and you had to make your own toast if you could work the toaster! we just had orange juice and coffee. Loads of drunks etc outside the hotel until the early hours! mostly the staff should be put out to grass! Barcelona itself was fab !

Reviews.Title: “A clean and comfortable hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bluenosesontour
Reviews.Content: Having taken the airport bus to Plaza Catalunya, the hotel was just a 10 minute stroll with our luggage and we found it easily. Despite our early arrival at 11am we were given a warm welcome and our room was quickly made available. We had requested a quiet room in advance and were given a room on the back of the hotel. It was very quiet and we slept well. Although the room was quite small for the three of us it was comfortable and spotlessly clean. The hotel is in a traditional Spanish style and although it is quite simple it is very well located in the city centre, only 5 mins from the Ramblas and 2 metro stations. We enjoyed the substantial continental breakfast each morning, sitting outside on the pleasant terrace. Our return flight was late evening and there was no problem in storing our luggage at the hotel and keeping our safe deposit box until departure.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with parking”
Reviews.Author: JaneVanreusel
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of this hotel is that it is located between La Rambla and the Placa Catalunya, has parking facilities (28 euro a night), and is relatively easy to find by car. It is quiet, and is fairly good value for the price. The decoration is traditional Spanish but a bit on the tacky side. It has free wifi in the rooms, although we did not use it. The TV was poor quality. The breakfast was adequate, and the staff was pleasant and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Very noisy.”
Reviews.Content: First the good bits; the hotel is in a good location easy walk to Las Ramblas and Plaza de Catalunya (5 Minutes) where all the tour buses and Aero buses depart from and arrive to. The hotel is generally well placed for a few days in the city; the area itself is quite studenty with a number of universtiy buildings adjacent to the hotel. It is very old fashioned, in a sort of Spanish country style, lots of dark wood, carvings of figures, on the stairs old coaching prints etc and doesn't look like it has changed much since the 60's but all clean, tidy and well maintained. There is a lift and each floor is set out in a similar way with a small lounge sitting area which provide a good meeting point if there are a few of you travelling. I found the staff to be efficient, not over friendly but you just need to make a bit of an effort and they will geneally do the same, If you are North American or British you shouldn't Interpret the rather brusque manner as rudeness or hostillity it is simply appears to be the Catalan way. Breakfast is served in the dated but quite pleasant dining rooom on the first floor, usual buffet style, nothing to write home about but adequate and plentiful. No other meals available in the hotel and althought there is a bar it never opened. On arival my partner and I were given a small double room with en-suite at the centre of the hotel, the window opened up on to a cental well which was incredibly noisy at all times. I could hear other guest talking, water draining from baths, toilets being flushed and what sounded like building rubble being sent down a chute except that this noise continued all through the night. If we closed the window it was too hot so a sleepless first night was had. Next morning I asked to be moved and we were moved to a larger twin room at the front, Now we got the crowds on the street, the skate boarders who seem to like the area at the front of the hotel at 2 am, the person clog dancing upstairs the man tickling his daughter next door and in the early hours of the morning the refuse collectors doing their thing. In a city centre hotel you expect some noise but it was excessive here, largely down to inadequate sound proofing, for three nights I managed only a few hours sleep despite going out and buying earplugs. In summary then; Good location in a great city, efficient staff and good value for money but unless you are a very heavy sleeper or out clubbing until the small hours I would struggle to reommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed little gem”
Reviews.Author: thewelltravelled4
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this trip for us for my birthday in January 2011. What a lovely hotel, tucked away from the main hustle and bustle, but only 5 minutes walk from the main square in Barcelona. Whilst it is not a 5* hotel (you do not pay 5* prices) the staff are so friendly and helpful, and the "as much as you can eat" continental style breakfast buffet was more than enough for any appetite. We were given a choice of rooms and decided on a room on the 5th floor, with a lovely balcony that looked out over the rooftops of Barcelona towards the mountains. The old period Spanish decor was beautiful - stained glass windows and murals. Bedrooms also furnished in this unique style. To make the most of your stay in Barcelona, buy a two day ticket for the Tourist bus (you can hop off and on at any time on the three routes available. well worth the money). Do see the Gaudi buildings as they are superb inside and out. We experienced 20+* in January - so the thick jumpers, hats, scarves & gloves were not requuired. Lovely city, easy to get around, safe (if taken with caution with regards to pickpockets as you would at home), lovely cafe society and a fabulous beach and the Med. Take the cable car up to the fort for fabulous view from the top (easily accesible from one of the tourist bus' bus stops)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good value for money”
Reviews.Author: phil_d0t
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 nights in January 2011, just after the new year but over the Catalan festival of the kings, so there was still lots going on. After reading some reviews on here about the hotel, we were expecting the hotel to be average at best, which we expected considering the reasonable price we paid. After our transfer from the airport late evening, we were greeted in a polite and prompt fashion at the desk, where they checked our passports and gave us some leaflets on personal safety and security in Barcelona, which helped us to be more aware of the risks of pickpockets (which we already were weary about). Our room at first was a twin, but after asking back down at reception they easily changed us to another double bedroom (I suppose it was easier due to low season). There are individual safes by the desk, which you can get a key for your stay for 5 euros. We made sure to always put valuables there whenever we were out of the room, and carried little with us out in the city. The room had a comfy bed, nice original features and a functional bathroom with shower/bath, just what we expected. The breakfast was a very nice continental one, and there was plenty of cereal, pastries, meat/cheese and fruit on offer, so we definitely didn't go hungry. Our room did not back on to anyone else's, but at points you could hear other people in their rooms and at one point someone snoring coming from a different floor! But to be honest this was not too much of a problem. View was not so good, just opened out into a kind of "shaft". Air conditioning was good, if a little noisy to sleep with, but again not a big problem. I left here with a great sense of satisfaction in that I feel I got real value for money here. A very beautiful and intimate hotel with efficient service, breakfast and incredible location (few hundred metres from las ramblas).

Reviews.Title: “Would like to give more points but can't”
Reviews.Author: richmondlady06
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location and excellent value with a good breakfast and very clean rooms. Unfortunately, the walls are so paper thin that the slightest noise from the other rooms can be heard and my friends complained about being kept awake. The other problem is petty theft. The hotel does provide safes in the reception area. I strongly recommend (as the hotel does) that anything that could possibly be of interest to a thief is stored there. I left a pair of earrings in a bag in my room (not particularly expensive but not particularly cheap either) and they were stolen. I have never had anything stolen from a hotel room until this particular trip. It is up to the hotel management to discourage casual stealing amongst their staff, not just to advise guests not to leave anything in their rooms. I would recommend this hotel if you want something cheap and clean and in a very good location. I would not recomment it you want to get a good night's sleep or not have to worry about your possessions being stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: mankysteve
Reviews.Content: Rooms where clean and tidy and kept that way the hotel over all was clean and tidy. Breakfast was good, good location and decent sized room. Just a huge shame about how the thin the walls where could hear people two floors up and the street noise in our front room was also very very bad. Unless you can sleep though plaything couldn't recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke !”
Reviews.Author: daccusWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay ( well should have been ) arrived at 10 pm ready to check in 5 couples, Only to be told they had no booking for us even though we had booked in march, lucky for us we had comformation email to prove booking, after much phoning round they found us a hotel for the night ( Hotel Barcelona 4* would recomend ),however we had to make our own way there walking around Barcelona at 11pm at night after flying was not ideal,In the moning we had breakfast there then had to return to Hotel castilla to be told there would be rooms but in the afternoon so we had t leave our bags and go out for the day. We had a super day took the open top bus and was amazed at the city. We returned to the hotel to get ready for the evening ,our room was nice had a balcony,walls are very thin and could here a lot of noise, the other 4 couples we were traveling with all thought the same. We thought ther may have been a token gesture as a apology but there was none. The bar as advertized was not open, breakfast was basic, after a good day round the city again we returned back got changed and went out for a meal at a lovely local restraunt recomended by the hotel which was lovely on return to the hotel we askedfor a early morning call to be up for the flight on arriving down at reception we were told nobody had turned up for breakfast and then they trouped us off to yet another hotel for breakfast !! We checked out with out any discount for our trouble,so we ended up having gone to 3 seperate hotels for our 3 night stay,was very dissapointed, I no that we were just unlucky, but it took the shine off our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend”
Reviews.Author: WImom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from Plaza Catalunya. We were given a larger room that would sleep five instead of three. There is noise on the street and motorcycles going up and down the street all night long so I would suggest an interior room. Historic hotel with antiques. Nice breakfast that is included with hard boiled eggs, toast, pastries, cheeses, meat, breads, orange juice, and coffees. Staff speaks English. I would book this hotel on www.hotelconnect.co.uk as it is cheaper than booking it directly on the hotel's website. I had the printout from hotelconnect and asked them if we could have the room for $20 less/night x 3 nights=$60 as listed on the hotelconnect website but they would not do it. That seemed funny to me as usually the hotel has discretion in doing this but they claimed that it was not allowed. Free internet was available.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahjane1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Meson Castilla with my mum, it was out first time in Barcleona. The hotle staff were so friendly and helpful, giving suggestions where to visit and where to eat. Great location, 5 minutes from the ramblas. Very clean room and lovely balcony. Lovely terrace to eat our breakfast, good selection for breakfast. Would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family and will def go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: janektb
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Meson Castilla. It was a great location very close to the Ramblas. Our room was very clean with nice fresh towels each day and a good shower in the bathroom. Breakfast on the terrace area was very pleasant. The staff very friendly. On the whole very good value.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: jacquieuk1
Reviews.Content: we booked a family room for 4 and was a little disappointed at 4 single beds in a very small room, though we were offered another room we chose to stay as we werent spending too much time at the hotel. The purpose of our trip which included myself, friend and two 12 year old boys was to sightsee, visit the beach and attend a football game which was on at the Nou Camp. The hotel was situated perfectly for us, just off Las Ramblas at the Catalunya Square end. The room included seperate bathroom, with bath and shower. We also had air conditioning at no extra cost. There was a fridge in the room with a selection of alchoholic/non alcoholic drinks. No tea/coffee making facilities but there was a vending hot drinks machine near reception. The rroms were cleaned everyday, with fresh linen and towels. Breakfast was in a large room and also a pleasant outdoor terrace with several tables. there was an excellant choice for breakfast, cereals, fruit, yoghurts, bread, toast, croissants and other pastries, eggs, cheese, ham. Tea coffee, fruit juice. breakfast was served from 7am to 11 am and plenty of choice throughout those times. The hotels decor is a little dated, its a family run hotel and has been owned by the same family many years. The staff are extremely helpful with tips/advice whilst in Barcelona. I personally, really liked this hotel, and would stay there again. We booked through hotel connect and got 5 nights for the price of 4, with a very good deal considering its location. Overall, the only negative was the room size as we were a group of 4 staying in one room, other twin/double rooms were fine. But a thoroughly enjoyable experience, and looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveller59_10
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the member of staff manning the reception was unwelcoming and when we queried why we hadnt been given the double bed we asked for he became very surly and unhelpfuland made us feel we were making a fuss over nothing Noone ever chased up our complaint either in the end we settled for the room we were given as it had a patio although sloping...Mmake sure you get to breakfast before 11 astheya re very prompt at taking the buffet dishes away it wasnt 11 when i went up for coffee but was told I was too late The lift was tiny and it served guests and staff alike o you waitied for ages no joke when you are on the 5th floor witha bad knee. We were told the hotel was full on the day of our so coud not kep our room on for a few extra hours - this changed when we said what if we we wanted to stay for one more night voila suddenly it was ok I wouldnt stay there again and wouldnt recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel basic”
Reviews.Author: sharoncoombe36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend, we were warned about pick pockets in the streets so were very vigilant whilst out and about therefore we were gutted to find someone had been in our room whilst we were out one evening, luckily only stole about £70 in total but didn't like the thought of someone going through our stuff. Hotel in brilliant location, perfect for everywhere! Red tourist bus great value and we saw everything we wanted. Taxi driver on our last morning told us ticket booth for girona airport didn't open until 9am and wanted to take us direct to airport for €120, we didn't really believe what he said so asked him to drop us to the bus station anyway only to find ticket desk opened at 3am and cost us €12 each, glad we trusted our instincts! All in all lovely city, had great weekend but you need to be on your guard the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but..............”
Reviews.Author: redlichtie50
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was Ok and the staff were helpful and pleasant. Public areas were fine and the breakfast room very spacious - although the actual terrace was quite small. However the room was tiny and as the only window was onto what I could only describe as a light tunnel it felt very - the air never seemed that fresh in the room. We were on the 4th floor I can only imagine it was worse further down. It was quite though - no chance of street noise. We took on board what previous posters had said about security and although we didn't find in the area that great we didn't feel unduly unsafe walking to and fro in either the daytime or nightime. We were not impressed by the room doors/locks as they looked very easy to break into so decided to rent a safe box. However it wasn't in the room so not convenient - all boxes were on the ground floor, close to the reception and the box while big enough to hold passport. money and some jewellery was too small for our camera and lenses. The breakfasts were maybe somewhat limited but more than adequate, no reason to go hungry - and for a machine the coffee was good. It does have air con but very noisy and we had to make a choice of getting the room cool or getting it quiet but couldn't get the two at the same time. We probably wouldn't return to, nor recomend this hotel to others but don't worry if you've already booked it, its all right for a few days/nights and has the advantage of being close to a couple of underground stations.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bilanderg
Reviews.Content: Meson Castilla is in a great neighborhood, close to the Old City, Las Ramblas, museums, the metro, great restuarants....all within easy walking distance. The rooms were comfortable and quiet, and we faced a noisy street. With the windows closed, we were not disturbed by the noise. Continental breakfast was plentiful, on a beautiful outdoor terrace, though there is indoor dining as well. The room was clean, bed comfortable. Not fancy, but fine. Each floor had beautifully decorated sitting areas, in the old Catalan style. We stayed for 4 nights, and would definitely go back. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: enncle
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stayed here for a long weekend, was a little wary on returning from night out as hotel a little secluded from main streets but no problems. very close to ramblas. hotel clean staff couldnt be more helpful. rooms small but did the job. would love to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price in Central BCN”
Reviews.Author: harlan8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here many years ago (1999) and this trip. It is a very quaint hotel. If you need every modern thing, it is not for you. They have wifi tho. Some rooms have a nice view, esp at higher floors. People are helpful, maybe not friendly. But for the price, especially on weekends, you will not do better. Breakfast was simple but adequate. 3 blocks from Ramblas & Pl Catalunya, near bars (gay and otherwise)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in Barcelona. Hotel Meson Castilla is well located near Plaza Catalunya and the Rambla. Rooms were spacious and quiet. Ours was on the back and had a private patio (#354). The windows and doors were heavy and insulated so I think they would be quiet on the street side too. Breakfast is included. Great cafe con leche, unlimited too. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There is a small restaurant around the corner called Petit Xaica that had terrific paella. It was very reasonable and their wine mark up was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Marsh12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Meson Castilla for a week this May and were very pleased with it. The reception staff were very helpful, especially at check-in, and everywhere was beautifully clean. The décor is most unusual. In 1962 the hotel was refitted in a 17th century rustic Catalan style. Much of this has been kept in good condition including elaborate painted bed-heads (with modern beds slotted into the frame), on the second floor at least. Most hotel beds are too hard for my taste and so were these – my wife likes a firmer bed and was happy (no hotel can suit us both). Also unexpected in the middle of a city was an outside breakfast terrace attached to the dining-room. Noise – We were in 243, a good-sized room at the back of the hotel. On Friday night there was a lot of noisy conversation (party on the terrace?) but it had stopped by midnight and the other nights were perfectly peaceful. Arrival – The Aerobus is much cheaper than a taxi. It will drop you on the north-east side of the Plaça de la Calatunya (you’ll know you’re there when the bus empties). You need to cross to the south-west side. Either take the road in the centre of that side (Carrer de Bergera but unlabelled) or go to the left to the south corner and turn right (Carrer de Pelai, also unlabelled but it’s where La Rambla starts and that is signed). Both roads meet at a corner having a Starbucks with outside tables. Across the road from the Starbucks is the narrow Carrer de Jovellanis (signed). Go down that and take the first right (Carrer dels Tallers, flagstones not tarmac). Turn left into Calle de Valldonzella (tarmac) and the Meson Castilla is 50 metres on the left. Departure- Our plane wasn’t till 21.25 but the hotel let us leave our luggage in a room behind reception without charge. Aerobus A1 goes to Terminal 1, A2 to Terminal 2. If you get on the wrong one there is a T1-T2 shuttle at the airport. Most of the UK flights seemed to be from Terminal 2

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: GoonerNeil
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very central, just moments away from Las Rambalas, reception staff very helpful. If you are going to buy sightseeing bus tickets make sure you purchase from Hotel as you will get a discount. The rooms were very basic, we had a double and a twin, the double had more space to move around in. A fridge is supplied with a small bar and price list - we used it to keep our drinks cold. If you get a chance try to get a room at the rear of the hotel as we woken up at the front by the bottles being collected for re-cycling.

Reviews.Title: “Central location.”
Reviews.Author: cosworth
Reviews.Content: Little hard to find hotel, but once there it had such charm in a retro way ! Rooms were not that large. Service was rather good as was the large dining hall / consevatory that led to a small terrace. Only down side is that Barcelona has become so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: stan08wales
Reviews.Content: stayed here for four nights,first impression when we walked into our room was that it was small.But the cleanliness of our room was second to none,bathroom spotless.extremely helpfull staff,location fantastic.Would recommend this hotel,and would stay there again if i went back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean Hotel, in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Marinak_22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really really good, it was clean, staff were all really nice, it was cleaned every day, and they even made a bow from my pyjama top on the bed lol! It was also very close to the main street and ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “Traditional & Quirky”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveldevon Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel mainly because I knew the area and where it was. Also the cost was reasonable compared to some in this area. The reception staff were very welcoming and helpful. The room was clean and warm but rather cramped as you could not walk past the end of the bed if you opened the wardrobe door. The bathroom again was rather small but clean towels and shower curtain was replaced every day. However we were only here for a couple of days so it really was not a problem. The breakfast room was large and pleasant but I would recommend going in early as after 9am items were not always replenished and it could then get monotinous being left with only sweet items. It would have been nice to have had hot food eg bacon fried eggs etc. Overall I felt very safe here and would use it again if only a short stay. Any longer than three days I would look to one of the others I have used in the past.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced, but central and a v. good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: SparkygirlSydney
Reviews.Content: Having to walk down a narrow street to find the hotel, I felt a bit uncomfortable at first. And also later that (Saturday) night, the place was swarming with young punk/Goth style people as the nearby shopping strip caters to their style...but it was ok. The room was small, but...clean..ditto the bathroom. Very noisy comings and goings with lots of door slamming late at night...A very nice restaurant nearby Tailler 73 (I think)...fabulous orange flavoured creme caramel...and lovely staff. too near Las Ramblas for me, but as a solo traveller, I like a quiet, more secure feeling location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: Martipants
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Meson Castilla with my wife and some friends. Hotel was very convenient - just off La Ramblas and close to all the major attractions. The rooms were fine, clean and modern and the breakfast was great. All the staff were very helpful and gave us a very useful set of introductory leaflets and a map of the locality on arrival. The only problem was the noise from the street - me and my wife had room 125 which was at the front of the hotel looking out onto the street. The noise from the street was virtually non stop on Saturday and almost as bad on the other nights as well. Our friends had a room not overlooking the street and had a very quiet nights sleep so I suppose we were just unlucky. Would definately go back but would check on the room location first.

Reviews.Title: “Very kind and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: pasqualesalerno
Reviews.Content: Before booking I've read a lot of reviews complaining about the noise, the bad attitude of the staff, and other things: well, probably things have changed a lot! The staff has been very friendly and helpful, the hotel is not really noisier than more expensive hotels in Paris, in London, in Amsterdam, .... The price is a bit high, but it was August and the hotel is in a really strategic - and beautiful, in my opinion - location. I've been really satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel with Air Con!”
Reviews.Author: Gogogo27
Reviews.Content: The hotel Meson Castilla is very clean and inexpensive - two criteria very important to me! We went for a stag do and had no problems with the place except initially having double rooms instead of twins but lads will sleep anywhere, haha. 5 min walk to the main avenue. Also has air conditioning which makes a big difference. Highly recommended no frills short stay. Great sights. Warning: beware pick pockets in the area. Barcelona is incredibly bad for it. Almost accepted part of their culture. My friends' mobile was stolen from him right outside the hotel by a local asking the time, struck up a conversation with my mate and then walked off. My friend then noticed the phone was gone when he got to his room 5 mins later. It really is that bad in Barcelona for pick pockets. Be vigilant.

Reviews.Title: “No AC”
Reviews.Author: AllieOc_Ca
Reviews.Content: If you think you're paying for 3 star accomodations, don't consider AC as an included accomodation. There is NO AC and for being a small bougtique hotel in the heart of Barcelona, it was hot and miserable and we did not receive any consolation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a 2*”
Reviews.Author: Squiffy045
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised upon arriving at this hotel how good it was for a 2*, very clean, a good continental type breakfast with decent orange juice!!!! and it was very central for all the main sights of Barcelona. Never felt intimidated by the large crowds of people on Las Ramblas, a thoroughly excellent break. We arrived quite late in the evening, and I left a handbag which I had purchased in the airport in the taxi from the airport, shucks what a waste of money thought I'd never see that again!!, especially not when you see how many taxis there are in Barcelona, but taxi drivers get my vote the next day he returned it to the hotel, cost me 10 euros (my choice) but how surprising is that in this day and age. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going for a short city break!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for What I Wanted and Needed”
Reviews.Author: gdwishes4u
Reviews.Content: This sweet little hotel had employees that were extremely helpful. My room was just as it is seen on their website. It will meet your travel needs. It is small, even for one, but more than adequate with a private bathroom and a tv that had the BBC. Outside of my window I could see sweet little balconies of other rooms. Mine didn't have a balcony. The elevator was a smll lift so I worked on my glutes and used the stairs every time I went to my room. It helped work off the delicious seafood dish from the Cuatro Gatos restaurant. The breakfast in the morning at the hotel was in a dining room or you could eat on their terrace with gorgeous flowers. It included various pastries, meats, cheeses, whole small tomatoes, olive oil for bread (mmmmm) a free flowing cafe con leche fountain, and few other items. The location was extremely convenient to La Rambla, the metro, shopping, the contemporary art museum and the market. I didn't have an issue with it but some might...Friday night music and cheerful chanting came through my window from a few blocks away. It started at 18:00 and didn't stop. It put me to sleep. I loved it, but many people might not. Saturday and Sunday night were extremely quiet. I paid 84 E/night in early June 09. I think I got a good price two months prior because the news stations were doing stories on hotels all over the world needing to fill up their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Frienfly & Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Hx_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear for 3 nights in Apr. Was not sure when I booked through Thomson as it is only rated as 2 stars however I was told it had good reviews from Thomson customers. Well what a suprise - the hotel is spotless, the staff were very professional & helpful with general tourist type questions. Breakfast was simple but again well prepared, the dining room clean with some very interesting decour. Rooms were spotless functional but simple - adequate for a few nights bed & breaksfast which is just what this hotel is about. Location is 5 mins walk to the main parade in Barcelona Le Ramblas and within a few mins of the bus & tube stations. Would definately use again if I came to Barcelona for another short break. For those wanting a longer / family holiday type break then this may not be for you if your used to spacious accomodation & views.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel , would definatly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Dodoe
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel , staff very helpful and friendly, very clean all thru hotel, room maid exellent. lovely continental breakfast. good location only few minutes walk to La Ramblas, would definatly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Advise earplugs”
Reviews.Author: thegins
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel. Convenient location for La Rambla and Place Catalunya. Good breakfast and pleasant staff. However, I would recommend taking ear plugs. Had a room on the street-side and the street noise went on until well after 3am, and within the hotel there was noise from banging doors etc and, despite the high ceilings there seemed to be lots of noise from very heavy-footed people above. But I enjoyed my stay. It was a good sized room and the bed was really comfortable and good shower which was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Alwaystravelling99
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 3 nights in Barcelona at this hotel. The good points are the price bearing in mind the excellent location at the top of La Rambles and a short walk to the underground station and the shops. However the hotel rooms are in need of a revamp and i found the breakfast very bland. The rooms were cleaned daily but were very small and lacked tea making facilities. The air conditioning is turned off during the day and the walls are extremely thin. A little tip for Barcelona, get the hotel to book your Restaurant. All the best Restaurants have long queues and thats not what you need after a long hard day sightseeing!!! Also purchase your underground tickets as a book of 10 trips its alot cheaper than buying singles. You will use all ten believe me...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer service”
Reviews.Author: BerniUk_Midlands
Reviews.Content: Uk 23.08.08 We just returned from spending 5 nights in Barcelona. Our Stay was at the Meson Castilla...we chose this hotel because they described themselves as a friendly,warm , family run hotel. The staff were neither friendly or warm...there was absolutely no customer service, at times they were rude and ignorant, we never had any conversation or questions relating to whether our stay was satisfactory. On arrival, the weather was extremely hot and humid, we were quite disappointed that the ac wasn't left on in the room, so we had to wait for the room to cool down before doing anything. Although there was a gentleman holding the doors open in reception...we didn't get help with our cases! We spent 5 nights here, the bed linen never got changed untill the 4th day when i queried this , they apparently told us it was changed daily....we knew it hadn't been changed for 4 days, quite appauling and un hygenic considering the weather was extremely hot. We were completely confined to sitting either in reception or our bedroom, although the hotel had other seating areas with tables etc the air conditioning was always switched off making it unbearable to sit anywhere else apart from reception which we didn't fancy because of the unfriendly staff. The advertised terrace is only accessible during breakfast time! Although rooms are air conditioned, the hotel switches the AC off from 9-1am during the morning which causes inconvenience if you happen to be in the hotel at those times. The Hotel is also situated down a back street leading to the Ramblas, during the daytime this street is busy but during the evening it is quiet and i would advise not to wander down this street alone. We woud have overlooked all of the above if we had customer service, but the staff were very unfriendly, very rarely greeted us, even on leaving they never said bye or i hope you enjoyed your stay...I would never reccomend this hotel, CUSTOMER SERVICE is important whether its a 2 star or 5 star hotel. The good point was that we quite often visited 'The Cellar Tapas bar' this was up the road close to our hotel ....they served great food, although it was small the staff were friendly, it was buzzing, and we went back a few times because they gave us great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location AND Cheap”
Reviews.Author: JenY_Travels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Meson Castilla with my husband, 22 year old daughter and 16 year old son. The hotel staff were charming and we all loved it's old world style. We booked a family room for 4 but came in a day earlier than planned. We were given 2 separate rooms as the family room wasnt available offered at the 1 room price which we were all very happy with. It's been said by many other reviewers but we loved the location - it was perfect and offered something for all our differing tastes eg. a very cool vintage shop directly opposite for my daughter, skateboarding with the locals at MACBA for my son (just round the corner) and shopping, arts and food in Ravel and the Barri Gotic that we all enjoyed. It was also a close walk to the fabulous El Born area and we couldn't have asked for more. We also drove to Barcelona and found the carpark both cheap and very accessible under the hotel. In regards to other comments about the danger of the area - I would tell you it's just like any other major city. I dont drop my guard in my own home city and we treated Barcelona the same, didnt have any issues and felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tc_spurs
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, easy to get to from the square. Had 3 days city break and this is just what I needed. Advise anyone going to use this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel and location for a short visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireElaine
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break to Barcelona. The hotel is ideally place 5 minutes from the Playa da Catalunya where you can catch buses to all locations, or walk to the many wonderful sights the city has to offer. The hotel is reached down narrow streets, but we felt quite safe to walk them at night. The area is renowned for its music shops, but is also undergoing some redevelopment. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful throughout our stay. They also provided safe storage for our cases after checking out and before leaving for the airport. When we arrived we requested extra pillows and these were provided immediately. The rooms were comfortable and clean, with fresh towels every day. The only downside was that our room had a window on to an internal light well, so it was difficult to check the weather! Breakfast was buffet style with a good variety and more than you could eat. We would quitel happily recommend this hotel to friends or use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Central, quiet, careful budget”
Reviews.Author: Philip_Michael
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews shows very different reactions to this hotel, which are useful in guaging what one's own reaction might be. My observation is that it very near the Placa de la Catalunya, at the top end of main section section of the Ramblas, so very central - a definite plus. It is an attractive building on a quieter side road, not an attractive one, but then again not on the Ramblas or a main thoroughfare - another definite plus. I asked for a quiet room at the back of the hotel, near the top, and had a reasonable view (no. 575) - yet another definite plus. The water pressure in the tap became a problem, although the shower kept going. The rooms are somewhat small, slightly dingy, and the furniture 'quaint'. The interior walls are thin, although we only shared one internal wall; all rooms lead off the central lift/stairwell. The breakfast was reasonably varied. The staff were fine, then again I tried to use my terrible Spanish as far as I could. Beforehand, they did not respond to emails, but I used my tour operator communicate my special requests. The Reding round the corner is more modern, with a restaurant, but might be noisier? There are also roadworks near both hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Coisceim
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - just far enough away from La Rambla to escape the touristy madness there and yet perfect for lugging a suitcase from the metro station/airport bus on Placa Cataluyna. The area is a mix of old residential and student quarter so it is lively but the noise is just mopeds and chatter and rooms to the front have internal and external shutters so it's easy to block it out. Some guidebooks warn of a red light district and there is one small area about eight-ten minutes walk away that is certainly open for business at night but the atmosphere isn't threatening. The hotel itself is very good value for the price - they've made an effort with the furnishings which give a nice olde world character and while the rooms are small and not very sophisticated, everything's in working order, the beds are good and the cleaning very thorough. Staff were very pleasant and happy to hold on to bags until night time on the day of departure, and breakfast is brilliant for late starters - served from 7-11 and there's plenty of it. The lack of a bar shouldn't be a put-off - there are a good few late night corner shops around so buy a bottle of wine and curl up on one of the leather chairs or sofas in the lobby or first floor common area and read by the big standard lamps - the perfect way to end a day.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of the location!”
Reviews.Author: Lispol
Reviews.Content: 27th January 2008 I stayed in this hotel as part of a group earlier this month. Whilst I agree with other reviews that this hotel is very clean and the breakfast is adequate I would warn people of the location. It is worth noting that before we checked in we were handed a leaflet on personal safety and to be wary of handbag thieves. We had been warned and I have stayed in Barcelona previously . None the less, that evening my friend and I were mugged and my friend's bag was stolen. In the struggle I was knocked to the ground and sustained substantial injuries to my face. This all happend literally around the corner of the hotel. One of the problems with the hotel is that there is no bar or place to buy coffee. There is a coffee machine at reception but this is not ideal. I doubt if we would have gone out late in the evening had there been a bar in the hotel . I have noted that in some websites that is lists a bar at this hotel but we did not see one. Two other members of the group had a similar experience the next day at a cash machine on the Ramblas. I would advise anyone, if they must go to Barcelona to stay on a main street and avoid hotels in side streets. The police are less than helpful. It took three attempts to get them to take a report and on the last occasion, it was due to a nice young policeman that took pity on us. It's seem that you must talk to the police through an official interpreter if you don't speak the language, and waiting for one takes forever. It's pointless really as the police will do nothing about the crime anyway. If you need to,try to report to the tourist police. (I was informed of this later). The police would like to blame 'other' nationalites for the spate of handbag snatching but it both incidents they were young well dressed spanish/catalan youths. The authorities do not take this crime seriously. It's seems to be very much accepted. I know too many that suffered similar fates in Barcelona. There are other cities in Europe that are well worth seeing. My advice for what it is worth if you have not booked your flights, go elsewhere! One other thing, there are roadwork or construction near this hotel and the noise is deafening. That alone should drive you away!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: turistore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is rated two stars, but it could well deserve more. Clean, spacious, furnished with a light, unkitschy touch of "Spainity". Good complimentary breakfast, held in a "real" breakfast room. Rooms with a nice balcony, kept very clean (daily change of sheets and towels). Staff kind and discreete, speaking several languages. Very central position, in the free time you can walk along The Ramblas and enjoy the core of Barcelona life. Fare acceptable, taken into account also the central position. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Barcelonal”
Reviews.Author: principessauno
Reviews.Content: We Were thrilled with the location the room had a simple charm most of the staff were helpful. the breakfasts were great and the abience of the dining room great. we enjoyed our little balcony and the noise from street construction did not bother us at all. i will recommend this hotel to my fellow travelers. we enjoyed our return to barcelona and hope to do so again soon and will stay at meson castilla again..

Reviews.Title: “Noise can be a problem”
Reviews.Author: RoyAustralia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and we found the staff okay. The breakfasts were great however the walls were thin ! Dont know if it was just our room but the first night we were next to three backpackers who obvioulsy got a last minute room and we could hear EVERYTHING from their room. We complained and the reception staff did contact them to little avail. The next night a quiteer family moved in but we could still hear a lot. Given the hotel is reasonably expensive this did affect our stay quite a bit. Otherwise no complaints..

Reviews.Title: “pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: ukdroo
Reviews.Content: we were a little disappointed at first because the room seemed quite small but soon got used to this. There is roadworks going on outside at the front and this created a lot of noise so it was not really possible to have the window open so needed aircon on all the time which was reasonably quiet. The bed was comfortable and bathroom clean. Very nice buffet breakfast either in breakfast room or outside on terrace. Staff were helpful. Great location, felt safe all around, walked pretty much everywhere. Great Tapas bars in roads adjacent to Placa de Catolonya and Gaudi architecture five mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was rude”
Reviews.Author: ARWNewYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel meson castilla in Barcelona was near Las Ramblas. This is where the postive attributes ended. I had booked two rooms for our trip in July 2007. A double with a cot and a triple with a cot. Upon our arrival we were informed that a cot really means a crib. The woman at the reception desk was quite agrumentative and kept insisting that a cot in any language meant crib. The reception staff was not very eager to assist us and told us that they didn't have any other rooms available. At our insistance she made a few phone calls to the other Husa International Hotels of which Hotel Meson is a part and found rooms for us. The photos online of Hotel Meson make it appear old world charm when in reality it's just old world. The rooms are quite small but clean . Breakfast was pretty good. All in all this hotel was not worth the price. Aggie Weil Syosset, NY

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: WandererWellington
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Meson Castilla for a week this May. At first I stayed in a room at the front of the hotel with a friend. It was quite possibly the noisiest place I have ever stayed! Perhaps because the room was at the front of the building, but it was really really bad! Later I moved to a room further back, this was slightly better but very dark and quite dated. Overall the hotel has a certain faded charm and the breakfast area (roof terrace) is quite nice. Staff tended to be rather abrupt and even rude but were reasonably helpful when necessary. I booked my stay here having read many glowing reviews on Trip Advisor, and while the location is good, I would not recommend this hotel so highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: Wilber4ce
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location for walking to Placa Catalunya, Las Ramblas, the metro, the tour bus stop, etc. There are some shops nearby and vending machines in the hotel. My main concern during our stay was the road from Las Ramblas is a pedestrianised one and felt like dodgy territory at night (we saw a woman have her handbag snatched or at least the chap tried, she was a burly lass!). Other than this (don't head out alone at night), it was difficult to find fault. The rooms had everything you needed except tea/coffe making facilities and the brekkie was great with something for everyone. Children are welcomed and there are settees on all landings (some right outside the rooms conveniently). There is a lift and a roomy reception area. We spent some time trying to find our way to the outside terrace (not the breakfast one) but one of our party had a terrace outside their room anyway. Would go there again :-)

Reviews.Title: “hotel fantastico! Vive le Rock!”
Reviews.Author: swampig
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous decor and ambience. Brilliant breakfast: coffee, juice, cold meats, fresh bread rolls, cereals, tortilla, fresh fruit and scrummy pastries. Staff were extremely helpful and accomodating; especially when we attempted to speak our very limited Spanish, (which always brought a smile, if not fits of giggles). Rooms have air conditioning. Double beds are big enough for four! Bathrooms have sink, wc, bidet, bath and 'hand' shower. Everything was very clean and towels and sheets changed daily. Basic, but very comfortable and everything you need. Area is perfect if you like heavy metal, rock or gothic nightlife and shopping. Valhalla club de rock is about ten paces from the front door! Don't let the graffiti put you off...streets are hosed down during the night and bins emptied every hour or so. There is never any litter. Vast number of eateries on the doorstep, 2 mins walk to Las Ramblas ( but we kept off it as very dodgy ). Easy walk to Barri Gotic, which is full of quirky shops, bars and beautiful architecture. Barcoloneta and beach about 30 mins walk (cos there's so much to look at, it seems like half that).

Reviews.Title: “Quite decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: KTVirginia
Reviews.Content: Pros: +Central location - easy to walk to major sites and transport +Room and bathroom were very clean and bathroom/furnishings in good condition +Contrary to other reviews, though perhaps not overtly friendly, staff was actually quite polite +The breakfast included in the price was very satisfying, though it did not vary at all during the course of our stay Cons: -The actual street where the hotel is located is not very picturesque (grafitti on the building opposite, etc) -The hotel has an outdated 1970s feel (lobby and rooms have bathroom tile-type floors) rather than trendy/funky feel as advertised/reviewed in many magazines Overall, the Meson Castilla was a very good value, though not a particularly interesting place to stay. On my next trip to Barcelona, I will look for a hotel that has a little more character, but would not be displeased to stay at the Meson Castilla again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Very Central”
Reviews.Author: The_Shaddow
Reviews.Content: I loved the atmosphere of the hotel, it was very confortable and the decore appeared to be very Spannish. It seamed to cater to both spanish people and a wide range of other nations. My room was compact and basic but very comfortable with decent storage units (with a good supply of hangers) and a combination shower and bath. The bath was very small so I don't think most people could lie down fully streached in it. The breakfast was basic but it had a variety of cereals (including muesli and cornflakes), 2 different types of pastries (which changed each day) and 3 different types of bread and rolls (including bread you could use to make your own toast). They had both ordinary milk (hot and cold) and Soya milk. As previously mentioned they have a left luggage facility and safes available off the reception area. They ask for a 25 Euro deposit to use the safe but you get it back when you return the key All of the hotel staff were all very friendly and were able to offer good advice when asked. If you're traveling by foot from Placa Catalunya, one of the easiest ways to get to the the hotel is going down the Rambas and take the first street on the right after Pelai which is called Tallers. At the end of Tallers on tthe left you will come to Valldoncella (its can be called Valldonzella on street signs/ maps) and near the start of the street you will see the hotel (th street is before Placa Castella). Would definately stay at the hotel on my next visit to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Family Rendezvous”
Reviews.Author: AegeanLight
Reviews.Content: Our family of nine, 3 generations ages 22 to 83, just spent 7 days in 4 rooms at Meson Castilla. It was terrific. Nice clean rooms. Superb breakfast and breakfast room. Helpful staff; don't understand reviews to the contrary . Great location. Not fancy but really pleasant. Don't hesiutate unless you're a stuffed shirt!

Reviews.Title: “The Spanish Experience”
Reviews.Author: kazz36
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from the Lovely Meson Castilla. On arrival from our monarch flight, cases and all went to get a taxi.. We arrived at the hotel in 20 mins, costing 29. euros which is quite pricey, although there is a shuttle bus you can get from outside the Corte de Ingles Dept Store that are frequent and cheap. We checked in straight away, we requested a terrace and we got room 243 which was tradional and quite, very spanish and IGNORE comments about staff they were very friendly and helpful. I have visited this hotel and barcelona before so I knew what the Immediate Vacinty and where to go. Do not go to any restaurants on the ramblas they are out to rip you off and when asked for tapas IE patatas bravas they were not, and they do not offer glasses of wine only by the bottle. Try off the ramblas and back streets. Wine very cheap and the supermarket called carrefour on the ramblas is fab. Hardrock cafe a must for people who only want chips burgers etc, however a good atmosphere. Macdoanlds and Kfc are better in spain than england, but I do prefer spanish food. All sites amazing and Sagra Famila is outstanding. We went on 09/12 and it is very christmasy shopping is brill. Will be going back someday as it is an amzing city. do recommend this hotel for anyone that wants comfort cheap and traditional. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, central location”
Reviews.Author: nedsram
Reviews.Content: This is part of the Husa hotels chain. Located on a side street close to Placa Catalunya and Placa Universitat, and a hundred yards from La Rambla, this hotel is ideally located for touring the old town. The building is very olde worlde, with a very nice first floor dining room and patio. Some rooms have small balconies overlooking the street or internal courtyards, and most bedrooms are en suite. We found the hotel and our room to be comfortable, and the reception staff to be reasonably helpful, though not especially friendly. Our room had a small TV, although apart from BBC World and Sky News, most channels were Spanish or Catalan. We had two fairly minor quibbles. First, the noise. Our room overlooked Carrer Valdonzella, and the noise was intrusive until the early hours of the morning. If this is of concern, it would be best to ask for an inward facing room. Second, whilst the breakfast was adequate, it was hardly inspiring, with a rather limited and unchanging choice. The immediate area (northern Raval) is rather run down, with graffiti all over the place. However this adds to the genuine character and charm of the area. There are several good value restaurants within easy walking distance, some offering excellent value set menus. We would recommend in particular the Biblioteca in Carrer Junta de Comerc.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, well located.”
Reviews.Author: McD-Dublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Meson Castilla for 4 nights in early November 06. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to La Rambla so is very well located. I had asked for a triple room but got a twin room with an extra camp bed. The camp bed was actually comfortable but the room was a little cramped. The bathroom was a decent size. Overall the room was basic but clean. The hotel has six floors but the lift only goes to the 5th floor. Our room was on the 6th floor so we had to drag ourselves and our suitcases up two flights of stairs. Not a problem if you are fit and healthy but if you have any kind of back problem I’d get another room. Fortunately there are only 2 rooms on the 6th floor. The lift is small and can just about hold 3 people with their suitcases. The hotel offers breakfast until 11am which is great but often there wasn’t much food out on the buffet table after 10.00am. Staff will replenish if you ask them to do but you need to ask as they don’t seem to check food supplies themselves. Breakfast was just ok. It consisted of orange juice (straight from the largest catering can I have ever seen), toast, various breads, cereal, yoghurt and fruit. Also some strange looking cold (processed) meat which I avoided.
